N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1850.12 - Remote Conferences

State Regulations

All counsel who have duly appeared in a proceeding in
compliance with Surrogate's Court Procedure Act Article 4, will be permitted, in the discretion of the court, to participate in early settlement and pretrial
conferences and to argue pre-trial motions remotely, where extended distance to
the courthouse or other compelling circumstances render a personal appearance
impractical upon the following procedure: (a) Early Settlement and Pre-trial
conferences. At least five court days prior to the scheduled conference date, counsel requesting a remote appearance must notify the court in writing of: (1)
the reason counsel wishes to appear
remotely; (2)
the names of all
other counsel who will attend such conference; (3)
that all other appearing counsel have
consented to the remote appearance; (4)
that an official court reporter will or
will not be required; and
(5)
where
two or more counsel wish to appear remotely at the same conference, in lieu of
a separate request from each party, all counsel may designate one party to make
the foregoing written request. (b) Pre-trial motions. Simultaneous with the
filing of any pre-trial motion, answering or reply papers, but at least five
court days prior to the return date, counsel requesting leave of court to argue
for or against said motion remotely must include among the pleadings, a
separate affirmation setting forth: (1)
the
reason counsel wishes to appear remotely; (2)
that all other appearing counsel have
consented to the remote appearance; (3)
that on the hour of the return date of
said motion said counsel will be available and appear remotely before the court
and remain available for the argument of the motion. (c) Notification. After the court has
reviewed the request of counsel to appear remotely, notification will be sent
to counsel approving or denying such application. Notes
